page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: As with many rural areas, little change over the years. The largest landowner was the Duke of Bedford but ownership is now fragmented. Mining brought a brief era of industrialis- ation but most of the mines in the area were small and were closed by the beginning of the 20th centuary. The mine at Collacombe Down was worked briefly during WW2 for ochre. Chipshop is so called because miners were paid in 'chips', tokens which could only be spent in the Co. shop. Ref.(Truck Acts). The largest house, Collacombe Barton was the seat of the Tremayne family and a Royalist stronghold in the Civil War. An avenue of trees (St Marys) was restored in 1977 for the jubilee of Q.Elizabeth 2.Sydenham Damerel primary school closed in 1950's, became a workshop and is now a dwelling.
